TI: Spatial Cognition: Grid Cells Harbour Three Complementary Positional Codes.
AB: The firing fields of mammalian grid cells, which map an animal's environment, lie on hexagonal lattices. Three new studies report significant field-to-field differences in the firing rates, a finding with far-reaching consequences for how grid fields form and encode spatial information.
